Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandie Newton.(n)

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: Detectives hunt a killer who kidnaps his victims and forces them to play sadistic games with life-or-death consequences. Meanwhile, two strangers wake to find themselves chained to pipes in a filthy, derelict bathroom - and at the mercy of the madman, who sets them a twisted challenge. Horror, written by and starring Leigh Whannell, alongside Cary Elwes, Danny Glover and Dina Meyer.(n)

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: An Elvis-obsessed ex-con and his lover set off on a nightmarish journey across America pursued by a variety of bizarre and deadly characters. David Lynch's dark road movie, starring Nicolas Cage, Laura Dern, Diane Ladd, Willem Dafoe, Harry Dean Stanton and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: The Devils
programme.desc: A sexually liberated priest in 17th-century France attracts the hatred of the King and the church with his radical views. When an obsessed nun accuses him of witchcraft, the cleric's enemies strike, using increasingly brutal tactics in their efforts to prove him a heretic. Ken Russell's historical drama, starring Oliver Reed and Vanessa Redgrave.

programme.title: Johnny Guitar
programme.desc: Saloon manager Vienna opens a casino in readiness for the boomtown days expected when the railroad arrives in town. A hard-nosed female rancher plans to stop her from attracting unwanted settlers onto her land, so Vienna hires a gunslinger for protection. Western, starring Joan Crawford, Mercedes McCambridge, Sterling Hayden and Ernest Borgnine.

programme.title: March of the Penguins
programme.desc: Luc Jacquet's Oscar-winning nature documentary follows a colony of emperor penguins on a journey hundreds of miles across the Antarctic ice to reach their breeding grounds, enduring harsh weather conditions and freezing temperatures along the way. Once they have mated, the males stay to guard the eggs while the females return to the sea to gather food. Narrated by Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangster's accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his boss's millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchie's crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton.

programme.title: The Salvation
programme.desc: A Danish settler in the Wild West is joined by his wife and son, but they are soon murdered. He avenges their deaths, but his actions attract the wrath of a ruthless gang leader. Abandoned by his friends and neighbours, the peaceful pioneer is forced to stand alone to enforce the law in his new home. Western, starring Mads Mikkelsen and Eva Green.

programme.title: Appaloosa
programme.desc: Straight-shooting peacemakers Everett and Virgil try to restore order in a town under the control of crooked rancher Randall and his murderous gang. However, the pair find their friendship threatened by the arrival of attractive widow Allison, who leads Virgil to question his nomadic existence. Western, starring Ed Harris, Viggo Mortensen, Jeremy Irons and Renee Zellweger.

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: A drug addled private detective unwittingly becomes embroiled in an elaborate kidnapping case in Los Angeles during the 1970s involving an old flame, her billionaire boyfriend and his wife. Comedy drama based on Thomas Pynchon's acclaimed novel, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Josh Brolin and Reese Witherspoon.

programme.title: Million Dollar Baby
programme.desc: A down-on-his-luck boxing coach nurses a grudge because his best fighter has abandoned him for the big time. When a 31-year-old waitress turns up asking him to train her, he refuses outright. However, her persistence wins him round and the pair go on to form a strong professional partnership and successful career. Oscar-winning drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, alongside Hilary Swank, Morgan Freeman and Anthony Mackie.

programme.title: Hustle & Flow
programme.desc: A pimp and drug pusher decides to change his ways after reaching the age at which his father died. Using his experience of life on the streets, he becomes a rapper, and an encounter with a local hip-hop star gives him the perfect chance to begin his career in music. Drama, starring Terrence Howard, Anthony Anderson, Taryn Manning and Isaac Hayes.

programme.title: RocknRolla
programme.desc: A Russian mob boss sets up a profitable real-estate scam in London and soon every criminal in the city is after their share. The gangster's accountant hires a trio of crooks to take his boss's millions, while a rock star with a penchant for faking his own death causes further mayhem by stealing a valuable painting. Guy Ritchie's crime comedy, starring Gerard Butler, Tom Wilkinson and Thandie Newton.

programme.title: Snatch
programme.desc: An unlicensed boxing promoter and his dim-witted sidekick convince an Irish gypsy to step in for their injured fighter, but find themselves drawn into a match-fixing racket. Meanwhile, the loot from a diamond heist goes missing, leading to a bloody conflict between Russian gangsters and a Jewish mob. Guy Ritchie's comedy drama, with Jason Statham, Brad Pitt, Benicio Del Toro and Stephen Graham.

programme.title: Quadrophenia
programme.desc: A teenager in 1960s London is unhappy with his lot in life, but believes he has found a place to belong in the mod subculture and their feud with the rival rockers. As the mods gather in Brighton for a weekend that turns to violence, his naive vision of the world is cruelly shattered. Drama based on the Who album, starring Phil Daniels, Leslie Ash, Sting and Ray Winstone.(n)

programme.title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas
programme.desc: A reckless sports writer and his lawyer hit the highways in search of the American Dream, heading for the Nevada gambling capital in a convertible stocked with alcohol and drugs. Comedy, adapted by Terry Gilliam from Hunter S Thompson's book, starring Johnny Depp, Benicio Del Toro, Ellen Barkin, Christina Ricci and Tobey Maguire.(n)

programme.title: March of the Penguins
programme.desc: Luc Jacquet's Oscar-winning nature documentary follows a colony of emperor penguins on a journey hundreds of miles across the Antarctic ice to reach their breeding grounds, enduring harsh weather conditions and freezing temperatures along the way. Once they have mated, the males stay to guard the eggs while the females return to the sea to gather food. Narrated by Morgan Freeman.(n)

programme.title: The Necessary Death of Charlie Countryman
programme.desc: A troubled American travels to Romania in the aftermath of his mother's death. He becomes obsessed with a cellist he meets who is concealing a violent past. His efforts to romance her could cost him his life following a run-in with her brutally violent husband. Drama, starring Shia LaBeouf, Evan Rachel Wood and Mads Mikkelsen.(n)

programme.title: The New World
programme.desc: A 17th-century English settler in America falls in love with a native princess, but as conflict erupts between their people he is forced to abandon her. She is converted to Christianity, adopting European culture and forming a romance with a tobacco planter, but remains torn between two worlds. Terrence Malick's epic historical drama, starring Colin Farrell, Q'orianka Kilcher, Christian Bale and Christopher Plummer.(n)

programme.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou
programme.desc: Three bumbling crooks escape from a chain gang and strive to get their hands on some hidden loot, but encounter all manner of scrapes and strange characters along the way. The Coen brothers' comedy inspired by Homer's Odyssey, starring George Clooney, John Turturro, Tim Blake Nelson, John Goodman and Holly Hunter.(n)

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: A Texan hunter who took a stash of money abandoned at the site of a botched drug deal is pursued across the state by an implacable hitman with no qualms about killing anyone who gets in his way. Meanwhile, a world-weary sheriff struggles to make sense of the escalating chain of violence. The Coen brothers' Oscar-winning crime thriller, starring Josh Brolin, Javier Bardem, Tommy Lee Jones, Kelly Macdonald and Woody Harrelson.(n)

programme.title: Big Eyes
programme.desc: Aspiring painter Margaret Keane marries a controlling man who sells her artwork. As the paintings of large-eyed children grow tremendously popular, Margaret discovers he is claiming to have painted them himself, and she and her daughter are forced to live a lie for years - until she finally resolves to prove his deceit in court. Tim Burton's fact-based drama, starring Amy Adams, Christoph Waltz and Terence Stamp.(n)

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: A student causes chaos in an exclusive private school with his temperamental nature - and things go from bad to worse when he develops a crush on a teacher. A wealthy but miserable businessman strikes up a friendship with the troubled teenager, but when he also falls for the same woman, all-out war is declared. Wes Anderson's comedy drama, starring Jason Schwartzman, Bill Murray, Olivia Williams and Brian Cox.(n)

programme.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou
programme.desc: Three bumbling crooks escape from a chain gang and strive to get their hands on some hidden loot, but encounter all manner of scrapes and strange characters along the way. The Coen brothers' comedy inspired by Homer's Odyssey, starring George Clooney, John Turturro, Tim Blake Nelson, John Goodman and Holly Hunter.(n)

programme.title: No Country for Old Men
programme.desc: A Texan hunter who took a stash of money abandoned at the site of a botched drug deal is pursued across the state by an implacable hitman with no qualms about killing anyone who gets in his way. Meanwhile, a world-weary sheriff struggles to make sense of the escalating chain of violence. The Coen brothers' Oscar-winning crime thriller, starring Josh Brolin, Javier Bardem, Tommy Lee Jones, Kelly Macdonald and Woody Harrelson.(n)

programme.title: The Departed
programme.desc: A cop infiltrates the inner circle of a feared Boston mobster, unaware a fellow officer is already an informant on the gangster's payroll. When both the crooks and the police discover they have a mole in their ranks, the two detectives realise they are in sudden danger and try to expose each other. Martin Scorsese's Oscar-winning thriller, starring Leonardo DiCaprio, Matt Damon, Jack Nicholson, Mark Wahlberg, Martin Sheen and Alec Baldwin.(n)

programme.title: Wild Things
programme.desc: A high-school counsellor is accused of rape by a student whose advances he spurned - and unfortunately for him, one of her peers backs up her story. Thriller, starring Neve Campbell, Denise Richards, Matt Dillon, Kevin Bacon, Theresa Russell, Robert Wagner and Bill Murray.

programme.title: Picture Perfect
programme.desc: An ambitious executive hires a man to pose as her fiance to give her a stable image at work and attract a colleague who is only tempted by unavailable women. However, her fantasy life soon spirals out of control, leaving her unable to tell the difference between fact and fiction. Romantic comedy, with Jennifer Aniston, Jay Mohr, Kevin Bacon, Olympia Dukakis and Illeana Douglas.

programme.title: Ice Age: Continental Drift
programme.desc: A cataclysm leaves prehistoric animals Manny, Sid and Diego lost at sea on a drifting iceberg. They try to find a way to return home, embarking on a journey that leads to an encounter with a ferocious band of piratical creatures. Animated comedy sequel, with the voices of Ray Romano, John Leguizamo, Denis Leary and Peter Dinklage.

programme.title: Fast Girls
programme.desc: A fierce rivalry develops between a talented working class sprinter and the wealthy daughter of a former Olympic medal-winner as they compete on the track. They are forced to settle their differences and work together when they are recruited for the same relay team. Drama, with Lenora Crichlow, Lily James, Rupert Graves and Noel Clarke, who also co-wrote the script.

programme.title: Ferris Bueller's Day Off
programme.desc: A cocky teenager plays truant from school and spends the day dragging his girlfriend and a reluctant friend into all manner of crazy adventures in the big city - while the school's dean of students vows to stop at nothing to prove the youngster is faking illness. Comedy, starring Matthew Broderick, Mia Sara, Alan Ruck, Jennifer Grey, Jeffrey Jones and Charlie Sheen.

programme.title: The Three Musketeers
programme.desc: A hot-headed swordsman sets off to join the King of France's royal guard, and falls in with a trio of former members who have fallen into disgrace. They join forces to defeat a plot to overthrow the king by an English lord who has built a deadly airship. Swashbuckling adventure, with Logan Lerman, Milla Jovovich, Matthew Macfadyen, Ray Stevenson and Luke Evans.

programme.title: RoboCop
programme.desc: A corporation that creates military robots seizes a chance to diversify into law enforcement when a Detroit cop is critically injured in a bombing. He is rebuilt as a crime-fighting cyborg, but struggles to regain his free will from his creators' control. Sci-fi thriller remake, starring Joel Kinnaman, Gary Oldman, Michael Keaton and Samuel L Jackson.

programme.title: The Treatment
programme.desc: Premiere. Police inspector Nick Cafmeyer investigates the abduction of a 10-year-old boy and the horrific ordeal the perpetrator inflicted upon the boy's parents while snatching their son. As events unfold, he begins to suspect the crime could be connected to the disappearance of his own brother, who was taken from his family at a similar age and never seen again. Belgian thriller, starring Geert Van Rampelberg. In Flemish.

programme.title: 21 & Over
programme.desc: A hard-working student's 21st birthday falls the day before an important interview for medical school. His friends persuade him to come out with them and celebrate, but what was supposed to be one quiet drink rapidly turns into a raucous night of debauchery. Comedy, starring Justin Chon and Miles Teller.(n)

programme.title: Sunshine on Leith
programme.desc: Two soldiers return home to the Scottish port town after finishing their tour of duty in Afghanistan. While they struggle to adjust to life as civilians, the parents of one of the squaddies prepare to celebrate their 30th anniversary in style. Musical featuring songs by the Proclaimers, starring George MacKay, Kevin Guthrie, Peter Mullan and Jane Horrocks.(n)

programme.title: Honey, I Shrunk the Kids
programme.desc: A professor invents a ray with the power to reduce objects in size. Unfortunately, his kids and their meddling friends activate it and are shrunk to microscopic proportions. When they are accidentally thrown out with the rubbish, the children have to contend with all kinds of animals and insects on their journey home across the backyard. Disney comedy, with Rick Moranis, Marcia Strassman and Amy O'Neill.(n)

programme.title: Dunston Checks In
programme.desc: A gentleman jewel thief's pet orang-utan runs amok in a swanky hotel, causing endless problems for the put-upon manager who has enough on his plate trying to ensure the establishment successfully attains a six-star rating. Family comedy, starring Jason Alexander, Rupert Everett, Faye Dunaway, Eric Lloyd and Paul Reubens.(n)

programme.title: Night at the Museum: Battle of the Smithsonian
programme.desc: The living exhibits at New York's Museum of Natural History are shipped to Washington's Smithsonian Institution - along with the artefact that brought them to life in the first place. Nightwatchman Larry tries to retrieve it, only to find the contents of the world's largest museum have been reanimated, including a pharaoh determined to take over the world. Fantasy comedy sequel, starring Ben Stiller, Amy Adams, Owen Wilson and Steve Coogan.(n)

programme.title: Ender's Game
programme.desc: In the future, the human race has survived conflict with an alien race, but the prospect of war breaking out again is a constant threat. A gifted boy is selected as a potential military commander for the coming conflict, and subjected to a gruelling training program to prove his worth. Sci-fi adventure based on Orson Scott Card's novel, starring Asa Butterfield, Harrison Ford and Ben Kingsley.(n)

programme.title: Die Hard
programme.desc: New York cop John McClane visits Los Angeles to see his family over the Christmas holiday. Stopping off at his wife's place of work, he realises armed men have taken over the building and are holding the corporation's staff to ransom - and only he has the ability to fight back. Action thriller, starring Bruce Willis, Alan Rickman and Bonnie Bedelia.(n)

programme.title: The Others
programme.desc: A woman awaits the return of her husband from the Second World War while struggling to care for her son and daughter. Both children suffer a violent reaction when exposed to daylight, forcing her to keep much of their isolated home on the island of Jersey shrouded in gloom. When the pair claim to see strangers in the house, their terrified mother begins to suspect that the souls of the dead are stalking the halls. Period supernatural thriller, starring Nicole Kidman, Fionnula Flanagan, Alakina Mann, James Bentley and Christopher Eccleston.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason works with a black boy on an act for the spring festival, but is shocked by the racial prejudice he encounters. Elizabeth has a crush on a new boy in her class.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prepare a surprise party for John and Olivia's 25th wedding anniversary, while their parents have surprises of their own in store.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles takes Caroline on a second honeymoon, but she cannot stop worrying about how things are back home.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Miss Beadle is injured and ordered to rest by Doc Baker, so Caroline takes over as substitute teacher of Walnut Grove School. During her tenure, an uneducated youth named Abel McKay enrolls, and is relentlessly teased because of his illiteracy.

programme.title: Desperate Rescue
programme.desc: A Jordanian man kidnaps his seven-year-old daughter and takes her back to his native country, prompting his ex-wife to enlist the aid of a crack anti-terrorist squad in a bid to steal the child back. Thriller, starring Mariel Hemingway, Jeff Kober, James Russo and Clancy Brown.

programme.title: Ride to Freedom: The Rosa Parks Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the life of Rosa Parks, the black woman who famously refused to give up her seat on a bus to a white man in 1950s America. The action prompted a massive outpouring of anger and sparked the rise of the civil rights movement. Angela Bassett, Cicely Tyson and Peter Francis James star.

programme.title: Returning Lily
programme.desc: An unhappily married woman receives news that the woman who raised her has died, and decides to fulfil her last wish by taking her ashes to Hawaii. On her arrival she becomes attracted to the dead woman's nephew, and also realises her mother, whom she has never met, is living on the island. Drama, starring Virginia Madsen, Lainie Kazan and Jason Mamoa.

programme.title: Guilty Hearts
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fact-based crime drama about an Illinois man who murders his wife in order to be with his mistress. Treat Williams, Marcia Gay Harden and Gary Basaraba star.

programme.title: A Killing in a Small Town
programme.desc: A Sunday school teacher looking for excitement embarks on an affair with a church-going man, leading to a fatal confrontation with his wife - but as the case goes to trial, she realises the odds are stacked against a jury accepting her plea of self-defence. Fact-based drama, starring Barbara Hershey, Brian Dennehy, John Terry and Lee Garlington.

programme.title: Prison of Secrets
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a new convict in a women's prison, who struggles to expose a corrupt system under which guards demand sexual favours from her fellow inmates. Stephanie Zimbalist, Finola Hughes and Gary Frank star.

programme.title: Jack Reed: One of Our Own
programme.desc: The maverick detective's partner is murdered by a hitman they were investigating and he sets out to bring him to justice with the help of the killer's girlfriend. Thriller, directed by and starring Brian Dennehy. With Susan Ruttan, Charles Dutton and CCH Pounder.

programme.title: Shadow of a Doubt
programme.desc: A washed-up alcoholic former lawyer is persuaded to return to the courtroom by an ex-lover, whose daughter is charged with murder. He agrees to take on the case, but finds himself at the centre of the media circus as the prosecution uses his drink problem to undermine his credibility. Courtroom drama, starring Brian Dennehy, Bonnie Bedelia and Fairuza Balk.

programme.title: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, about religious fanatic Ervil LeBaron, who believed he had God's permission to kill anyone standing in the way of his drive for wealth and power. Starring Brian Dennehy, Tracy Needham and William Devane.

programme.title: I Am Slave
programme.desc: Wunmi Mosaku stars in the story of one woman's fight for freedom from modern-day slavery. Twelve-year-old Malia is snatched from her home in the Numa Mountains, Sudan, and spends the next six years of her life working for a Sudanese family. At the age of 18 she is sent to London, where she is stripped of her passport and subjected to brutality and inhumanity, until she calls on all her strength to plan an escape back to the father who never stopped searching for her. Drama inspired by real-life events, with Lubna Azabal and Igal Naor.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason helps Verdie investigate her family history, while Elizabeth writes to a soldier serving in the war - but she tells him she is 18 and sends him a picture of Erin.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. Ben and Jim-Bob feel guilty after their carelessness causes Elizabeth to break both her legs.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Mary gives Laura a baby raccoon as a pet, but it bites both her and the family dog, leaving Charles worried it may have rabies.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The church needs a new bell, creating tension between the Kennedys and the Olesons.(n)

programme.title: A Song for the Season
programme.desc: An inspirational music teacher throws herself into preparing her students for a tuneful extravaganza. However, she remains blissfully unaware that the school is in financial difficulty and plan to close the music department. A dour administrator is sent to oversee the school's fate, only to face a crisis of conscience when he falls for the teacher. Romantic drama, starring Naomi Judd, Gerald McRaney and Alison Pill.(n)

programme.title: Brave New Girl
programme.desc: A teenage girl struggles to realise her dreams of stardom while trying to shake off the shackles of her humble Texas upbringing. Fortunately, she has her mother behind her, offering encouragement when the going gets tough. Family drama, based on the book A Mother's Gift by Britney and Lynne Spears, starring Lindsey Haun, Virginia Madsen and Jackie Rosenbaum.(n)

programme.title: Wicked Love
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman found in a car boot after an attempt on her life that leaves her in a coma. As her unfaithful husband and his mistress stand trial, a controversy erupts over whether her life support should be switched off. Starring Rebecca Gibney, Vince Colosimo and Maya Stange.(n)

programme.title: Guilty Hearts
programme.desc: Conclusion. Fact-based crime drama about a manipulative Illinois doctor who murders his wife in order to be with his mistress. Treat Williams, Marcia Gay Harden and Gary Basaraba star.(n)

programme.title: The Murder of Mary Phagan
programme.desc: Part one of two. A Jewish factory owner in 1930s Georgia is unjustly accused of murder. Despite all the evidence pointing in another direction, an ambitious prosecutor and an unscrupulous journalist whip up a frenzy of anti-semitism against the suspect. However, the state governor sees through the bigotry and does everything in his power to see justice is done. Fact-based drama, starring Jack Lemmon, Peter Gallagher, Kevin Spacey and Richard Jordan.(n)

programme.title: The Murder of Mary Phagan
programme.desc: Part two of two. A Jewish factory owner in 1930s Georgia is unjustly accused of murder. Despite all the evidence pointing in another direction, an ambitious prosecutor and an unscrupulous journalist whip up a frenzy of anti-semitism against the suspect. However, the state governor sees through the bigotry and does everything in his power to see justice is done. Fact-based drama, starring Jack Lemmon, Peter Gallagher, Kevin Spacey and Richard Jordan.(n)

programme.title: The Audrey Hepburn Story
programme.desc: Part one of two. Biopic of the glamorous Hollywood star, with Jennifer Love Hewitt as the sophisticated actress who took America by storm in the 1950s and 1960s thanks to roles in Funny Face, Breakfast at Tiffanys and My Fair Lady. With Frances Fisher and Eric McCormack.(n)

programme.title: The Audrey Hepburn Story
programme.desc: Concluding the biopic of the glamorous Hollywood star, with Jennifer Love Hewitt as the sophisticated actress who took America by storm in the 1950s and 1960s thanks to roles in Funny Face, Breakfast at Tiffanys and My Fair Lady. With Frances Fisher and Eric McCormack.(n)

programme.title: First Do No Harm
programme.desc: A woman decides to seek alternative forms of treatment for her epileptic son after the conventional methods employed by his doctors fail to have an impact on his welbeing. However, she encounters resistance from members of the medical establishment, who seek to take legal action to stop her removing her child from the hospital. Drama, based on a true story, starring Meryl Streep.(n)

programme.title: The Price of a Broken Heart
programme.desc: A woman learns her husband has been having an affair with his secretary for years and plans to abandon his family for her. The spurned wife responds by suing her husband's lover for $1million under a long-forgotten state law - resulting in a case that has far-reaching consequences for American divorce law. Fact-based drama, starring Laura Innes, Park Overall and Timothy Carhart.(n)

programme.title: Till Murder Do Us Part
programme.desc: Two-part drama. A woman is humiliated at being dragged through divorce proceedings by her husband and decides murder is the only suitable form of revenge. Starring Meredith Baxter, Stephen Collins and Michelle Johnson.

programme.title: Hidden Children
programme.desc: Part one of two. Fact-based drama about Orphaned Jewish children from across Europe fleeing the Holocaust, who find a hiding place in an Italian villa. With Ken Duken. In Italian.

programme.title: Barbara Taylor Bradford's A Secret Affair
programme.desc: An American woman breaks off her engagement to begin a new life with a journalist, but unfortunately her lover disappears while on a reporting assignment in Serbia. Drama adapted from Barbara Taylor Bradford's novel, starring Janine Turner, Fionnula Flanagan and Robert Mailhouse.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia's timid uncle Cody Nelson pays a visit to the family after losing his job in a bank, and John-Boy and Grandpa set out to find him a wife. However, he falls in love with Cordelia Hunnicutt, who has been married four times already, much to the disapproval of Olivia and Grandma.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy offers shelter to a gypsy couple with a sick child, but is shocked by the reaction of the rest of his family.

programme.title: The Unspoken Truth
programme.desc: A woman marries a dangerously volatile man, who one night shoots a man in a fit of rage. He forces her to claim she shot the man by accident, a lie which leaves her facing a life sentence and the possibility of losing her daughter. Fact-based drama, starring Lea Thompson, James Marshall, Patricia Kalember and Robert Englund.

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey.

programme.title: The Heroes of Desert Storm
programme.desc: Drama, based on the first Gulf War, as seen through the eyes of the men and women involved. Starring Angela Bassett, Daniel Baldwin and Kevin Kilner.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's A Perfect Stranger
programme.desc: A woman resigned to nursing her bedridden husband is swept off her feet by a handsome stranger and soon realises she is falling in love - but guilt and responsibility get the better of her. Romantic drama, starring Stacy Haiduk, Robert Urich and Darren McGavin.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Fine Things
programme.desc: A man marries the woman of his dreams, only to see her die of cancer - and while coping with the pain of bereavement, he finds himself subjected to extortionate demands from her drug-dealing ex-husband. Drama, starring DW Moffett, Tracy Pollan and Cloris Leachman.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Changes
programme.desc: Two single parents, a successful journalist and a wealthy, widowed heart surgeon, fall in love and rush headlong into marriage. However, the move proves to have far-reaching consequences for them and their children. Romantic drama, starring Cheryl Ladd, Michael Nouri and Christopher Gartin.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Full Circle
programme.desc: A rape victim struggles to overcome the trauma of her ordeal and learn to trust men again, without succumbing to her mother's cynical outlook on life. Drama, starring Jennifer Barker, Teri Polo, Corbin Bernsen, Eric Lutes, Reed Diamond and Erika Slezak.

programme.title: The Last Don
programme.desc: Three-part crime drama focusing on America's most powerful Mafia family, based on the novel by Godfather author Mario Puzo. Danny Aiello stars as patriarch Domenico Clericuzo, whose world falls apart when his son is murdered by rivals - the same gang whose leading protagonist is about to marry his daughter. Kirstie Alley, Daryl Hannah and Joe Mantegna also star, with an appearance by singer kd lang.

programme.title: Stolen Innocence
programme.desc: An unhappy, emotionally vulnerable teenager runs away from home and falls for a charismatic ex-convict, joining him as he travels the country on a crime spree. However, her psychopathic companion ultimately takes her hostage, so he can demand a ransom from her parents. Drama, starring Tracey Gold, Thomas Calabro, Bess Armstrong and Nick Searcy.(n)

programme.title: God Bless the Child
programme.desc: Poverty and hardship force a single mother and her seven-year-old daughter to move into a shelter for the homeless. Drama, starring Mare Winningham, Grace Johnston and Dorian Harewood.(n)

programme.title: In the Arms of a Killer
programme.desc: A rookie homicide cop lands herself in a dilemma after making the foolish mistake of becoming romantically involved with the prime suspect in a drug-related murder case. Thriller, starring Jaclyn Smith, John Spencer, Michael Nouri, Nina Foch and Sandahl Bergman.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy takes a trip to the city to raise the $200 required for his family to register their right to the land, while his siblings do their bit at home.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Kind-hearted John-Boy helps an illiterate woman learn to read and write in time for her daughter's college graduation. Richard Thomas stars.(n)

programme.title: In the Best Interest of the Children
programme.desc: A manic depressive woman is released from an institution and tries to regain custody of her five children. However, their foster parents wish to officially adopt them, and her eldest daughter believes that would be for the best. As a bitter legal battle ensues, the mother's mental health begins to deteriorate once more. Fact-based drama, starring Sarah Jessica Parker and Sally Struthers.(n)

programme.title: Custody of the Heart
programme.desc: An outgoing, ambitious career woman divides her time between work, family and caring for her elderly mother. But her stay-at-home husband develops a strong inferiority complex and demands a divorce, claiming he should get sole custody of the children. Drama, starring Lorraine Bracco, Martin Donovan, Dennis Boutsikaris and John Neville.(n)

programme.title: Butterbox Babies
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a couple who founded a maternity home in Nova Scotia during the Depression, only for a determined health inspector to expose their good intentions as a front for such crimes as illegal adoption and medical malpractice. Starring Susan Clark, Peter MacNeill and Michael Riley.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Kaleidoscope
programme.desc: Three young sisters and their brother are orphaned in early childhood, and while three of them are found loving and protective homes, one suffers a life of neglect and poverty. Thirty years later they are reunited, but the elder sister has a shocking secret she needs to share. Drama based on a novel by Danielle Steel, starring Jaclyn Smith, Perry King, Colleen Dewhurst and Claudia Christian.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Once in a Lifetime
programme.desc: An author reflects on her literary career while recovering from a road accident, but cannot help dwelling on the loss of her husband and baby - and further tragedy only serves to compound her sorrow. Drama, starring Lindsay Wagner, Barry Bostwick and Amy Aquino.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Vanished
programme.desc: A devoted mother's son is kidnapped, and as the FBI search widens, she is distressed to find herself suspected of involvement in the crime, along with a former lover who may not be what he seems. Drama set in the 1930s, starring Lisa Rinna, George Hamilton and Robert Hays.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Changes

programme.desc: After losing their virginity together in college, Lainey and Jake meet again at a sex-addiction support group. They vow to stay just friends, but their relationship makes them rethink their bed-hopping lifestyle in this raunchy yet sweet rom com(n)

programme.title: Clerks II
programme.desc: You can take the clerks out of the Quick Stop, but you just can't take the Quick Stop out of the clerks as Dante (Brian O'Halloran) and Randall (Jeff Anderson) prove in this long-awaited sequel to Kevin Smith's breakthrough comedy. Years after we last saw them, Dante is still toiling behind the counter at a New Jersey convenience store and Randall is still annoying customers at the video shop next door -- or at least they are until a fire burns down the strip mall, forcing Dante and Randall to look for work. Times are tough, and the guys find themselves embracing the ultimate indignity as they take jobs at Mooby's, a fast-food outlet where the burgers are advertised as "udderly delicious." While Randall's snarky attitude toward the public remains unchanged, Dante is trying to make the best of the situation as he plans to marry his fiancée, Emma (Jennifer Schwalbach Smith), and move to Florida. However, Dante's plans are complicated when he falls for Becky (Rosario Dawson), a funny and tart-tongued woman who happens to be his boss at Mooby's. Lurking about in the background, as always, are Jay (Jason Mewes) and Silent Bob (Kevin Smith), who for good or ill have changed even less with the passage of time than Dante and Randall. Clerks II also features Wanda Sykes, Ethan Suplee, and Trevor Fehrman, with cameo appearances from Kevin Smith regulars Ben Affleck and Jason Lee(n)

programme.title: In a Perfect World
programme.desc: An exploration of the effects of single-parents households through a profile of various men who were raised by single mothers(n)

programme.title: Roadies

programme.desc: Get Even Before Leavin'. With the Russian mob threatening his family, Ray goes on a road trip with Mickey to Primm in hopes of recovering money stolen from a local casino owner. programme.title: Reeker
programme.desc: Five students driving through the desert encounter the inescapable stench of death in director David Payne's retro-inspired slasher/monster/supernatural horror hybrid. The highway has been inexplicably closed, forcing five young travelers into a mysteriously abandoned travel oasis where they are soon confronted with disturbing visions of maimed travelers. Disturbed by the grisly series of visions and determined to escape the spooky motel and diner before whatever killed the previous customers returns, the frightened travelers soon meet a frantic stranger who claims to have recently lost his wife to a terrifying entity that seems to hover between life and death. As the night falls, a blind grad student with heightened senses proves the only hope for survival as the body count begins to rise and the smell of death becomes too suffocating to endure(n)

programme.title: The Last Survivors
programme.desc: An officer mulls sacrificing passengers on an overcrowded lifeboat in order to prevent the vessel from foundering(n)

programme.title: The Roost
programme.desc: Creatures of the night find new prey on the scariest night of the year in this horror story. It's Halloween night, and four friends -- Allison (Vanessa Horneff), Elliott (Wil Horneff), Trevor (Karl Jacob), and Brian (Sean Reid) -- are on a road trip en route to a friend's wedding when their car breaks down after running into something. Looking for help, the four happen upon the farmhouse of an elderly couple, Elvin (Richard Little) and May (Barbara Wilhide), which is located next to a huge barn. Elvin and May have already become lost in the darkness of the barn, and soon two of the lost travelers are suffering the same fate as they search for friendly strangers. However, while they can barely see a hand in front of their face, they discover they're not alone in the barn, which has become home to a huge swarm of bloodthirsty bats. The Roost is framed by an introduction and postscript from a television horror show host, played by Tom Noonan(n)

programme.title: Atari: Game Over
programme.desc: An exploration of the decline of video-game giant Atari and its secret burial of unsold "E.T." game cartridges in a New Mexico landfill(n)

programme.title: Molly Moon and the Incredible Book of Hypnotism
programme.desc: A London orphan named Molly Moon studies hypnosis, and uses her powers to escape from her orphanage and search for a friend who was adopted. However, she is soon distracted by the thought of becoming a movie star via mesmerism, as well as by a thief who wants her help with a heist(n)

There he is offered the oportunity to escape Death Row by taking part in a number of fights to the death with other prisoners. Breckel, the corrupt producer, plans to broadcast the illegal tournament live over the internet, but there could be more to Jack than meets the eye(n)

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg stars in Antoine Fuqua's thriller as Bob Swagger, an ex-Special Ops sharpshooter. Called out of retirement by Col Isaac Johnson to help foil an assassination attempt on the President, he finds himself framed as the assassin. Injured and on the run, he can only rely on Sara Fenn, the girlfriend of his ex-partner, and FBI agent Nick Memphis, who's come across evidence of the conspiracy. The three now have to evade Johnson and his cohorts in a race to prove their innocence in this intelligent action movie(n)

programme.title: Frank Miller's Sin City: A Dame to Kill For
programme.desc: The follow-up to the comic miniseries adaptation, tells Dwight's backstory as he becomes wrapped up in the thralls of femme fatale, Ava. Elsewhere in the seedy city, a mysterious gambler is set on taking down his sworn enemy in a high-stakes game of life and death(n)

programme.desc: A case of mistaken identity lands Josh Hartnett in hot water with rival crime lords Morgan Freeman and Ben Kingsley. Tarantino-esque crime thriller with Bruce Willis(n)

programme.title: The Spymasters: CIA in the Crosshairs

programme.title: The Alamo
programme.desc: With Dennis Quaid and Billy Bob Thornton in the cast, this historical drama features magnificent war scenes as it reconstructs the revolution over the independence of Texas, in 1836 –before, during and after the construction of the Alamo (a fort built by Spanish missionaries to catechize the natives). Texans and Tejanos (born in Mexico), led by William Travis, Davy Crockett (Thornton) and Jim Bowie, are besieged by an army commanded by Mexican dictator Antonio Lopez de Santa Ana. Later, however, the outcome of the battle of San Jacinto, under General Sam Houston (Dennis Quaid), is the defeat of the Santa Ana men, which finally leads to the independence of the state(n)

Meanwhile, the desperado's henchmen try to head them off and free their leader, because without him they're "like a pack of dogs without a master." Richard Roundtree, who played the original John Shaft in three '70s crime dramas, has a cameo as Jackson's uncle and namesake. Busta Rhymes, Vanessa Williams, Dan Hedaya(n)

programme.title: War
programme.desc: An FBI agent whose partner and family were killed by a notorious assassin sets out for revenge as the elusive triggerman sparks a sprawling gang war between the triads and the yakuza in the feature debut from prolific music video director Phillip Atwell. FBI sgent Jack Crawford (Jason Statham) is a man driven by vengeance. After his partner, Tom Lone (Terry Chen), and his family fell to bullets fired by infamous hitman Rogue (Jet Li), Crawford makes it his life mission to ferret out the slippery killer. Complications arise when it begins to appear as if Rogue has a mission of his own to carry out, and as triad boss Chang (John Lone) prepares for all-out war against yakuza boss Shiro (Ryo Ishibashi), Crawford and Rogue also come face to face as the secrets of the past emerge in a hail of gunfire(n)

programme.title: Twilight
programme.desc: Kristen Stewart stars in Catherine Hardwicke's adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's best-selling series of romantic fantasy novels about a teenage girl who falls in love with a vampire. When her mother remarries, Bella Swan moves to Washington State to live with her father Charlie. There, in the small, perpetually wintry town of Forks, she starts her new life, though she has no inkling of quite how different it's going to be. At her new school she quickly establishes herself as both a bit of a klutz and a hunk magnet. But she's not interested in most of the guys, apart from the moodily handsome, ashen complexioned Edward Cullen. And when he saves her from various threatening situations, their mutual attraction is sealed. There's just one problem he's a vampire. But although Edward and his undead family are 'vegetarians' who don't feed on humans, his breed find it very difficult to control their overwhelming desire for human blood when their emotions switch from love to lust..(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: New Moon
programme.desc: Catherine Hardwicke hands on the directorial baton to Chris Weitz for this second part of the cinematic adaptation of Stephenie Meyer's teen vampire saga. The chapter opens with Bella Swan (Kristen Stewart) on the cusp of her 18th birthday and blissfully happy with her undead beau Edward Cullen. But, while she's celebrating her birthday with Edward's family of 'vegetarian' vampires, a frightening incident convinces Edward that he's simply too dangerous to be around his sweetheart. He leaves the town of Forks in order to ensure her safety - leaving her behind, angry and depressed. Bella finds some relief from her emotional numbness through recklessly riding motorbikes and succumbing to the attentions of her friend Jacob Black. But he is also a supernatural being, and not one with a natural affinity to vampires..(n)

programme.title: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse
programme.desc: The third installment of the "Twilight" saga finds Bella forced to choose between Edward, a vampire and the love of her life, or Jacob, a werewolf and her best friend. The result of her decision may reignite the ancient feud between vampires and werewolves, while a scorned vampire bent on revenge appears responsible for a string of brutal murders(n)

programme.desc: Cinderella's wicked stepmother has tipped the balance of power toward the dark side in Fairy Tale Land, and now it's up to the put-upon princess to restore order and ensure that good triumphs in an animated adventure featuring the voices of Sarah Michelle Gellar, Freddie Prinze Jr., Sigourney Weaver, and George Carlin. For years, the Wise Wizard has worked hard to ensure that the scales of good and evil were always well-balanced, but as with any hard worker the Wise Wizard needs a relaxing vacation every once in a while. When the Wise Wizard goes on holiday, his faithful assistants Munk and Mambo make the crucial mistake of allowing Cinderella's wicked stepmother, Frieda, come into possession of their master's magical staff. With time fast running out before Frieda casts a shadow of darkness and sorrow over Fairy Tale Land, Cinderella must now awaken from her romantic dreams to take on her fearsome stepmother with a little help from her best friend, Rick, and a virtual army of heroic dwarves and fairies(n)

programme.desc: A documentary profiling the four-time Olympic gold-medal winning diver and one of America's first openly gay athletes. The film chronicles his successes, the discrimination he has faced, his struggles for financial security and his return to the sport(n)

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: In this Academy Award-nominated sci-fi action feature starring Shia LaBeouf, Tyrese Gibson, and John Voight, the interstellar battle between the Autobots and Decepticons rains destruction down on planet Earth. Both the Autobots and the Decepticons are fighting for the sole access to a talisman known as the Allspark, a cube with the capacity to grant infinite power to whoever possesses it. If the Autobots don't find it first, the Earth will be enslaved or destroyed by the evil Decepticons. No one knows where the cube is, but the information may be stored in the most unlikely of sources, as a gangly young Earthling named Sam Witwicky (LaBeouf), who's just picked up his first car, will soon find out(n)

programme.title: Black Mass
programme.desc: The true story of one of America's most violent and infamous gangsters, Whitey Bulger. Johnny Depp stars as Bulger, who was the brother of a state senator and was eventually convinced to wear a wire for the FBI to bring down the Italian mafia in Boston after they invaded his territory. Scott Cooper directs, with Mark Mallouk penning the screenplay based on Dick Lehr and Gerald O'Neill's 2001 best-seller Black Mass: The True Story of An Unholy Alliance Between The FBI and The Irish Mob(n)

programme.title: Maze Runner: Scorch Trials

programme.title: Next Friday
programme.desc: Hilarious follow up to Friday. Now it's Next Friday and Craig is still living with his parents in South Central Los Angeles while looking for a job and remembering his moment of glory four years earlier, when he finally beat local bully, Debo . But now Debo has escaped from prison and is looking to exact revenge on Craig. Craig's dad takes him to Rancho Cucamonga to hide out with his Uncle Elroy and cousin Day-Day, who have moved to the suburbs after winning the lottery. But once he gets there, Craig and his cousin have a string of suburban adventures that make his South Central experiences look tame

programme.title: National Lampoon's Van Wilder
programme.desc: Van Wilder might be starting his seventh year at Coolidge College, but graduation is the last thing on his mind. Armed with a personal assistant and a coterie of admirers, Van has reached the status of living legend on campus, throwing bashes that make geeks popular, raise money for charity and generally "inspire the uninspired. " But when Van's father refuses to pay any more of his son's tuition bills, Van must turn to party planning for profit in order to continue living in under-graduate bliss, thereby becoming the subject of an exposé by disapproving school journalist Gwen Pearson. What begins as a clash of wills, soon leads to unexpected romance as Van and Gwen both realize they have a lot to learn from each other. The only problem is Gwen's self-obsessed, frat house boyfriend, Richard, who is determined, at any cost, to put a stop to Van's rule as campus king

programme.title: The Brothers Grimm
programme.desc: Matt Damon and Heath Ledger play two con artist brothers who take advantage of local superstitions. Girls have been disappearing from a forest, and this time it may be real. Dir: Terry Gilliam

programme.title: Making of 'Trainwreck'
programme.desc: A look at "Trainwreck," a 2015 comedy about a commitment-phobic woman who finds herself falling for the subject of an article she's writing for a men's magazine. The film stars Amy Schumer, Bill Hader and Tilda Swinton, and is written by Schumer and directed by Judd Apatow

programme.title: McHale's Navy
programme.desc: Comedy adventure based on the 1960s American TV series of the same name and starring Tom Arnold as the titular Naval Commander. McHale and his men lead a charmed life stationed on a sleepy Caribbean island until the maniacal Major Vladakov (Tim Curry) invades a nearby island, putting a damper on the sailor's easy lifestyle!

programme.title: Other People's Money
programme.desc: Corporate raider Larry 'The Liquidator' Garfield sees easy pickings in the cable company of stolid old Andrew Jorgenson. But the veteran and his wife won't go down without a fight, particularly with help from his lawyer daughter Kate. Will Larry's lust overcome his greed?

programme.title: Wild Wild West
programme.desc: Will Smith and director Barry Sonnenfeld last struck gold with the international blockbuster Men In Black and they re-team for this rollicking action adventure movie that puts a brand new spin on the Western. Smith plays government agent Jim West, who finds himself paired with fellow agent Artemus Gordon when Dr Arliss Loveless plots to assassinate the President. Both West and Gordon have their unique talents - Jim is a witty charmer who can talk his way out of any situation, while Artemus is a master of disguise with a dazzling talent for inventing things - and they'll need every trick in the book if they're to outwit their new nemesis. Look out for some spectacular special effects, including a giant transportation device known as The Tarantula, as well as Salma Hayek, who co-stars as the sassy love interest

programme.title: Fathers' Day

programme.title: Meet the Spartans
programme.desc: From the creators of Scary Movie and Date Movie comes this tongue-in-cheek parody of the sword-and-sandal epics, dubbed Meet the Spartans. The 20th Century Fox production was written and directed by the filmmaking team of Jason Friedberg and Aaron Seltzer. Sure, Leonidas may have nothing more than a cape and some leather underwear to protect him from the razor-sharp swords of his Persian enemies, but that won't stop the brave leader and his team of 13 warriors from defending their beloved homeland against a powerful invading force that includes the likes of a mutant Paris Hilton, the Transformers, the Ghost Rider, and Rocky Balboa

Lynda Carter, Daniel von Bargen. Chandrasekhar also directed

programme.title: Wimbledon
programme.desc: Romantic comedy from the makers of Notting Hill. Peter Colt is a low-ranking tennis star whose misfortune on the court is only matched by his extremely bad luck in love. His life is transformed, however, when he is chosen as a wildcard to play at Wimbledon and, while there, meets and falls in love with a young American on the women's circuit. Their love match spurs him on to reach the tournament final, but will his good fortune hold out long enough for him to lift the prestigious trophy?(n)

programme.title: Louis C.K.: Shameless
programme.desc: Few comedians possess the verbal dexterity needed to balance jaw-dropping obscenity with universal insight quite like criminally underrated funnyman Louis C.K., and in this release of a live performance staged at the Henry Fonda Theater in Los Angeles and originally aired on HBO comedy fans can finally find out why C.K. is one of the stand up circuit's best-kept secrets. With topics ranging from creative profanity to honesty on marriage and loss of privacy in family life, C.K.'s side-splitting routine covers topics that everyone can relate to no matter what your status in life may be(n)

programme.title: Thunderbirds
programme.desc: Directed by Jonathan Frakes and based on the '60s British television series of the same name, Thunderbirds chronicles the intergalactic exploits of the Tracy family. Set in 2010, the world looks toward the mysterious Tracy Island when mere international security is not enough; the remote South Pacific island not only houses former astronaut and lifelong entrepreneur Jeff Tracy (Bill Paxton) and his five sons, but also serves as headquarters for the top-secret International Rescue organization. The unthinkable happens, however, when an insidious criminal mastermind known only as "The Hood" (Ben Kingsley) manages to get past the island's innumerable security measures and attempts to take over International Rescue. His goal: stealing the organization's five most advanced rescue vehicles, each of which was designed to accomplish a specific task, and using them for his own agenda. With Jeff and his four eldest sons deployed on a mission, there's only one person with any hope of stopping the takeover -- Jeff's youngest son, Alan (Brady Corbet), who vows to save his family and keep the Thunderbirds alive(n)

programme.title: Camp Nowhere

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: Cinema icon Al Pacino joins a powerhouse cast headed by of George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia, Don Cheadle, Bernie Mac, and series newcomer Ellen Barkin for this, the third installment of director Steven Soderbergh's popular series of glitzy crime comedies. The only hotelier in Las Vegas who can claim that each and every one of his establishments has earned the Royal Review Board's Five Diamond Award, Willy Bank (Pacino) has made more than his share of enemies during his impressive ascent. While most of Bank's adversaries amount to little more than the occasional nuisance, however, this powerful player is about to find out that picking your enemies in Las Vegas can be a true gamble. In betraying Reuben Tishkoff (Elliott Gould), Bank has finally crossed the one man who could bring his entire empire crumbling to the ground -- Danny Ocean (Clooney). Now Reuben is in critical condition, and Ocean is determined to strike back at the man who nearly murdered his mentor. Bank may have taken down one of the original Ocean's Eleven, but his efforts only managed to unite the remaining ten closer than ever before. As the opening of Bank's newest casino draws near, Danny and the crew set into motion a bold plan to humiliate the cocksure casino owner and forever tarnish his spotless reputation. It won't be easy, but if Ocean and his team can get their elaborate plan together in time for the opening of The Bank, they just might be able to deliver some serious Las Vegas justice(n)

programme.sub-title: My Story: Childhood During the Highland Clearances.
programme.desc: Grandad James takes Iona on a journey of discovery to find out what life was like for a child from the Highlands of Scotland over 200 years ago. Iona and grandad James dress up in clothes from the time known as the Highland Clearances. They learn about a boy called Lachlan and why he, and many other families, had to leave their homes and move to a new country. Together they discover what life was like for Lachlan in Scotland - where he would live, the language he spoke, the food he would have eaten and the jobs he would do to help his family. Iona and grandad James then visit an American township to see how different Lachlan's new life in America would have been and they try their hand at panning for gold.
